about-text:
We focus on exploring the connection between brain structure, function and human behavior, using magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

We investigate what underlies behavioral and functional differences between individuals, such as changes in functional and structural connectivity and differences in the brain’s microstructure.

In addition, we study learning-related brain plasticity by developing behavioral tasks that induce functional and structural brain modifications. For our work, we use advanced mathematical and statistical analysis methods.

We made it to the cover!.content: Our work on short-term plasticity following motor sequence learning was chosen for the cover of the Human Brain Mapping journal.

New paper published in the Journal of Ne.content:
Check out our latest paper on connectivity changes following traumatic brain injury.

We used diffusion MRI and graph theory measures to explore the brain connectivity alterations in a mice model of traumatic brain injury. We found changes in global and local measures of network integration and segragation at 7 days following the injury, which returned to baseline level at 30 days post-injury suggesting a possible compensation mechanism.
